pageContext.title: In brief: Tencent Music raises $1.1bn in New York IPO
pageContext.content:
China-based music-streaming company Tencent Music has raised nearly US$1.1 billion in its US initial public offering (IPO), with shares priced at the low end of its targeted range of US$13 to US$15 apiece.

Tencent’s music arm sold a total of 82 million American Depositary Receipts at US$13 per share, it said in a filing with the Hong Kong stock exchange. The IPO values the company at US$21.3 billion.

Tencent Music initially planned to launch the deal in October but it was postponed due to volatility caused by the US-China trade war and fears of slowing global growth.

Source: Reuters

seo.title: In brief: Tencent's music arm raises 1.1bn in US IPO
seo.description: The Chinese tech giant’s music-streaming service priced its IPO at the low end of expectations.
